trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure DNS Resource Provider REST API allows you to create and modify DNS zones and records hosted within Azure.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure DNS Resource Provider REST API allows you to create and modify DNS zones and records hosted within Azure.

trans-unit.source: Zones and records are managed as Azure Resources, see <externalLink><linkText>"Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources"</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups/</linkUri></externalLink> for more details on resources groups and Azure resources.
trans-unit.target: Zones and records are managed as Azure Resources, see <externalLink><linkText>"Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources"</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups/</linkUri></externalLink> for more details on resources groups and Azure resources.

trans-unit.source: The Azure DNS resource types are:
trans-unit.target: The Azure DNS resource types are:

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="e3723aaf-09c7-4556-9064-0a13d11c56b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"> REF _Ref414539072 \h \* MERGEFORMAT DnsZone</link> – a DNS zone within a resource group
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="e3723aaf-09c7-4556-9064-0a13d11c56b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"> REF _Ref414539072 \h \* MERGEFORMAT DnsZone</link> – a DNS zone within a resource group

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="c9e3f8c2-c5ba-4e59-84c7-5b0ce338daac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">RecordSet</link> – the set of records (within a zone) with the same name and record type.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="c9e3f8c2-c5ba-4e59-84c7-5b0ce338daac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">RecordSet</link> – the set of records (within a zone) with the same name and record type.

trans-unit.source: Each DNS record type is represented as a separate Azure Resource Manager resource type.
trans-unit.target: Each DNS record type is represented as a separate Azure Resource Manager resource type.

trans-unit.source: These resources are children of the ‘dnsZone’ resource.
trans-unit.target: These resources are children of the ‘dnsZone’ resource.

trans-unit.source: All operations conform to the HTTP/1.1 protocol specification, you must make sure that requests made to these resources are secure.
trans-unit.target: All operations conform to the HTTP/1.1 protocol specification, you must make sure that requests made to these resources are secure.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see “<externalLink><linkText>Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn790557.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>”.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see “<externalLink><linkText>Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/azure/dn790557.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>”.

trans-unit.source: Note: The Azure DNS service is currently in preview mode.
trans-unit.target: Note: The Azure DNS service is currently in preview mode.
